The 'translocase of the inner membrane (TIM)' is a complex of proteins found in
the inner mitochondrial membrane of the mitochondria. Components of the TIM
complex facilitate the translocation of proteins across the inner membrane and
into the matrix (biology). They also facilitate the insertion of proteins into
the inner mitochondrial membrane, where they must reside in order to function,
these mainly include members of the mitochondrial carrier family of proteins.
